_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

The right way and the wrong way [mn139:1: The middle way of practice by which the Realized One was awakened
Flattering and rebuking without teaching Dhamma
Neither flattering nor rebuking, and just teaching Dhamma
The pleasure of renunciation, the pleasure of seclusion, the pleasure of peace, the pleasure of awakening
Saying untrue, false, and harmful things behind someone’s back
Saying true and correct, but harmful things behind someone’s back
Saying true, correct, and beneficial things behind someone’s back
Saying untrue, false, and harmful things in someone’s presence
Saying true and correct, but harmful things in someone’s presence
Saying true, correct, and beneficial things in someone’s presence
Insisting on local terminology and overriding normal usage
Not insisting on local terminology and not overriding normal usage
The way of non-conflict (a multiple item: We shall know the principles beset by conflict and the principles free of conflict.
Knowing this, we will practice the way free of conflict.
Subhūti, the gentleman, practices the way of non-conflict.
